Description: Stamp with a lotus motif in relief; knob at back; micaceous hard fired Nile clay.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The stamp was maybe used in a pottery workshop at Naukratis. It can be compared with stamps used in Aswan workshop for the production of stamped late Roman red-ware bowls or Egyptian Red Slip A Ware (Bailey 2008, 160, nos 3596-9). For another possible pottery stamp from Naukratis: Boston, Museum of Fine Arts 86.669. Bailey, D.M. 2008, Catalogue of the Terracottas in the British Museum 4: Ptolemaic and Roman Terracottas from Egypt, London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (PA.16)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4875 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
